results.title: A Bear in hot water
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington takes his first bath at the Brown’s and makes a terrible mess with soap and water. Based on a chapter of the Michael Bond story “A Bear called Paddington”.

results.title: A Visit to the hospital
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington Bear at large in a hospital fails to find Mr Curry, the patient, but gets to see a psychiatrist instead. Amusing word association games follow. Animated by Ivor Wood. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.
results.description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.

results.title: Paddington turns detective
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington receives a torch from Mr Gruber as a gift and receives an answer to his morse code signals from Mr. Brown’s greenhouse! He assumes the identity of Feathers Locke, Detective and proceeds to investigate, even fingerprinting Mr. Brown’s prize marrow! Adapted from Michael Bond’s book ‘More about Paddington’. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Music by Herbert Chappel.

results.title: Paddington goes underground
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Mrs Brown and Judy take Paddington on a trip to the London Underground where he experiences problems with the escalators and station staff.

results.title: Please look after this bear
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Presents an animated adaptation of Chapter I of the book “A Bear called Paddington” by Michael Bond. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Animation by Ivor Wood. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: Paddington recommended
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from Chapter 6 from the book Paddington Takes the Air. While waiting to dine with the Browns at a fashionable restaurant, Paddington is mistaken for Duncan Hyde, the famous food expert. Hoping for a favourable review in his food guide, the manager offers Paddington a choice of meals on the house. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.

results.title: A Visit to the dentist
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from the book “Paddington takes the air”, Paddington visits the dentist and in the course of events, both Paddington and the dentist lose a tooth.

results.title: Paddington and the Christmas shopping
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Paddington and the Christmas shopping is adapted from Chapter 6 of “More about Paddington” by Michael Bond. Paddington is on his way into the distinguished shop of Crunbold and Ferns but experiences trouble with the revolving doors. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: A Spot of decoration
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The wonderful world of Paddington Bear”.
Adapted from the book ‘More about Paddington’. Paddington decides to decorate the attic at number Thirty-Two Windsor Gardens. Despite the best intentions, everything he does turns into disaster. Narrated by Michael Hordern. Suitable for lower and middle primary level.
